pull.title: Qt RPC console: history sensitive-data filter, and saving input line when browsing history
pull.body:
Rescuing uncontroversial parts of #5891

Alternative to #8746

events.body: Concept ACK
Concept ACK. Maybe add a comment that signrawtransaction can be removed from this list if it's ever split into a wallet call and a utility call.

If we're adding privkey stuff here, then `signmessagewithprivkey` needs to be added.

Won't those commands not show up in history? I think it should at least show that the command happened.
Concept ACK

@luke-jr instead of masking out the arguments as I did in my PR, what if you just added the command name to the history. Since all the commands pass through that filter method, you could have it return the string that goes into the history. For non-filtered commands, it returns the command itself. For filtered ones, it just returns the command name.

> Instead of masking out the arguments as I did in my PR, what if you just added the command name to the history. 

Would work for me. My main comment on doing it @achow101 's way with masking individual arguments is just that that is too brittle and hard to maintain. If having just the command name to the history is useful in any way, which I doubt a bit with the incredible autocompletion that the debug console has these days, you could do that.

I consider it useful to have _any_ placeholder in history, since otherwise one might <up>-<enter> and get the second-to-last execution instead. At least with a dummy placeholder, they get an error/help.

issue.title: [Qt][RPC] Hide passphrases in debug console history
issue.body: Right now passphrases in the debug console are displayed in plaintext on screen as well as in the history. This will replace all the passphrases entered with the `walletpassphrase` and `walletpassphrasechange` RPCs with a placeholder, `**PASSPHRASE**`, in order to prevent the loss of a password due to people looking at the debug console history.

events.body: 1. The passphrase is still visible in the console as executing command when calling `walletpassphrase` (should this be done in a different pull request?) 2. Nested commands makes this a little bit more complex. Executing "a dump" `getnewaddress(walletpassphrase(test))` results in executing `walletpassphrase(test)` but actually not "hiding" the passphrase from the history.
Rebased and taught it to handle nested commands. When a filtered command is encountered, all its parameters are replaced with "()" in the command history. Unit tests now check this.

Tested a bit.
Needs coverage for `importmulti` now.

events.message:
Qt/RPCConsole: Save current command entry when browsing history

Shell-like, but doesn't store changed history commands until executing it.

Qt/RPCConsole: Don't store commands with potentially sensitive information in the history

Filters importprivkey, signrawtransaction, walletpassphrase, walletpassphrasechange, and encryptwallet

Bugfix: Do not add sensitive information to history for real

Original code was missing braces, and short-circuited before checking everything after importprivkey
Qt/RPCConsole: Refactor command_may_contain_sensitive_data function out of RPCConsole::on_lineEdit_returnPressed
Qt/RPCConsole: Add signmessagewithprivkey to list of commands filtered from history
Qt/RPCConsole: Truncate filtered commands to just the command name, rather than skip it entirely in history
Qt/RPCConsole: Make it possible to parse a command without executing it
Qt/RPCConsole: Teach RPCParseCommandLine how to filter out arguments to sensitive commands
Qt/Test: Make sure filtering sensitive data works correctly in nested commands
Qt/RPCConsole: Use RPCParseCommandLine to perform command filtering
GUI/RPCConsole: Include importmulti in history sensitive-command filter

events.body: Looks good. Squash/combine some commits?
Rather not squash... They look reasonably logical progression, and squashing is a bad practice anyway.
Tested ACK 8562792095a78fdef2dacc3c5e32c41206df4c87
Tested ACK 8562792095a78fdef2dacc3c5e32c41206df4c87

`Wshadow` statistics: 
   1 qt/rpcconsole.cpp:173:56: warning: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]

```
qt/rpcconsole.cpp:173:56: warning: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
    auto add_to_current_stack = [&](const std::string& curarg) {
                                                       ^
qt/rpcconsole.cpp:167:17: note: previous declaration is here
    std::string curarg;
                ^
1 warning generated.
```
@paveljanik That looks like a bug in the compiler?
Why do you think so? It is clear that `curarg` inside the block shadows `curarg` outside.
@paveljanik: Maybe write a fix PR?
@paveljanik It's a different scope, and lambda functions do not inherit the scope of the calling function beyond what you tell it to.
@luke-jr Not by default, but your lambda has capture list `[&]`, which means it does capture everything.
I thought `[&]` was only supposed to capture stuff actually referenced?
@luke-jr Well, yes. But if -Wshadow wants to catch potential errors resulting from variables being identically named, it should absolutely catch this.
@luke-jr What name do you want me to use inside lambda instead of `curarg`? `strArg`?
Sure

issue.title: Rename lambda argument name to prevent shadowing
issue.body:
Fixes warning after #8877.

Removed warning:
```
qt/rpcconsole.cpp:173:56: warning: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
    auto add_to_current_stack = [&](const std::string& curarg) {
                                                       ^
qt/rpcconsole.cpp:167:17: note: previous declaration is here
    std::string curarg;
                ^
1 warning generated.
```

issue.title: TODO for release notes 0.14.0
issue.body:
Post things here that need explicit mention in 0.14 release notes

I'd strongly prefer for pulls to just update `doc/release-notes.md` directly, but if they somehow slip by, mention them here.

Overview:
- [x] ZMQ on Windows (#8238) (done in wiki)
- Changed RPC calls:
  - [x] `getaddednodeinfo` got rid of first argument (#8272) (done in wiki)
  - [x] `getinfo` was deprecated (but not yet removed) (#8780) (done in wiki)
  - [x] `preciousblock` RPC call #6996
  - [x] `importmulti` RPC: #7551 
  - [x] `getmemoryinfo` #8753
  - [x] `setnetworkactive RPC (#8996)
- [x] Mention that the GUI confirmation target has been changed from the default of 25 to 6 (#9036).
- [x] Mempool dump to disk (#8448) (done in wiki)
- Several memory usage improvements 
  - [x] (shared pointers, LockedPool #8753)
  - [ ] Share unused mempool space with coin cache (#8610) 
- [x] Qt RPC nested commands: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7783 (done in wiki)
- [x] Qt sensitive data filter: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8877 (done in wiki)
- [x] Removal of priority estimation (#7730).
- [ ] Address relay changes (#8594, #8661, #8740).
- [x] Named RPC arguments (#8811).
- [x] Manual block file pruning (#7871)
- [x] Deprecate use of getrawtransaction for confirmed transactions with unspent outputs without -txindex (#9520).

~~**Note:** we're doing an experiment with editing the release notes draft in a github wiki.
The most up to date version of the release notes is thus at https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/0.14.0-Release-notes . Feel free to edit them there if you want to add any of these items.~~
